tweets.text: If @EnvAgency saw this on a permitted site they would issue a notice immediately and it would lead to a prosecution. When they go onto an un-permitted site it takes two years and lots of letters. What damage has been done in that period? I don’t get why they delay stopping this. https://t.co/N2ZE7mlh91

Vital £42m Hull tidal defence flood scheme now better protecting thousands of homes & businesses across the city, part of @EnvAgency's exceeded target of better protecting 300,000 homes in England.
https://t.co/2IFLOEEpVh https://t.co/kE87u5Uhwv

urls.title: Vital Hull tidal flood defence scheme complete
urls.description: Residents in 113,000 homes in Hull are now better protected from flooding as the Environment Agency’s £42 million Humber frontages scheme comes to fruition.

tweets.text:
Great to see these leaky barriers being installed in Pott Shrigley #Cheshire! 

As well as #slowingtheflow, natural flood risk management often has other benefits such as providing habitats for wildlife & and helping to improving air & water quality 

#ThursdayMotivation #FCERM https://t.co/hpsQDTMiEr

@EnvAgencyMids @ConnectRightUK Dirty water from landfill sites should not be allowed to sit festering amongst the poison, why don’t you come to Newcastle Under Lyme & look at the contaminated water in Whalley’s Quarry @StinkStopthe

We’ve delivered our largest ever programme of #flood and coastal defence improvements!

Working with partners, we’ve helped protect over 300,000 homes from flooding and supported communities to become more resilient to #ClimateChange

Read more: https://t.co/5Bgax4pg9n

#FCERM https://t.co/mS2pKBFb18

Vital £42m Hull tidal defence flood scheme now better protecting thousands of homes & businesses across the city, part of @EnvAgency's exceeded target of better protecting 300,000 homes in England.
https://t.co/2IFLOEEpVh https://t.co/kE87u5Uhwv

tweets.text: A few photos of our recently installed 'Leaky Dam' interventions aboe Pott Shrigley to help alleviate flooding to properties downstream @EnvAgencyNW #NFM #NaturalFloodManagement  #SlowTheFlow #UpperMerseyCatchmentPartnership https://t.co/iZ54HFqBUC

@john3lee @wyrecouncil Hi John. You are correct it is in Lancashire 🙂 the video showcases the Rossall sea defences which was one of  three projects delivered by the Fylde Peninsula Coastal Programme. The £63 million scheme in Rossall reduces flood risk to 7,500 homes!

Shoring up our coastal defences, alongside our partners, over the last 6 years has

👉Reduced #flood risk to homes, businesses & infrastructure 🚄

👉Helped fight #climatechange 

👉Made our coasts a great place to live & visit

Can you guess which scheme this is? 

@wyrecouncil https://t.co/5ZZXsNi1LO

Spent the morning planting 2,000 reeds with @cpvolgroup. Great team effort 😀 Looking forward to lots more volunteer events with the group in the future @CroxtethHall @EnvAgencyNW #ACCP #NFM https://t.co/njHfFZqOPZ

OYSTER NEWS! @Wild_Oysters are placing 1269 oysters in NE England! Sunderland Marina & @PortofBlyth will be the🏠of these incredible🦪nurseries – releasing >3billion oyster larvae into the waters over the next 3yrs! #SeedTheSea #OceanRecovery @EnvAgencyYNE @bbcnewcastle @GWKNE https://t.co/58ET8W5qss

tweets.text:
Our flood defences in #Mytholmroyd are just one of the many schemes that have helped us reach our target or 300,000 homes better protected from #flooding since 2015. This £41m scheme better protects 400 homes and businesses. 
#FCERM 
#Flood 
#ClimateChange https://t.co/70MVp4EW1K https://t.co/pL6DbQfEqz
This is a great job in the National #Flood and Coastal Risk Management team. @EnvAgency #makeadifference #AdaptOurWorld #TeamEA👇 https://t.co/fhRBCwX82C

@EnvAgencyYNE @EnvAgency @LivingWithH2O @YHClimateCom @YWHelp @Hull_Yorkshire @HullMaritime @OliverHarmarEA @JamesBevanEA @EmmaHowardBoyd @Hullccnews @HighwaysYORKS Please could you protect our homes in Newcastle under Lyme from the poisonous stink of Walley’s quarry?! @RedIndustries2 @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe #stopthestink

Massive props to @frazer_HX who leaves @EnvAgency this week for exciting new adventures. Keep an eye on this cat... 

Frazer has done more than nearly any human in the UK to advance emergency alerting to save lives.

Thanks mate. Hell of a legacy you're leaving behind... 🙌🏼

Filming @EnvAgencyNW @GranadaReports @WoodlandTrust all the benefits of flood management helping to secure 50k properties in the region - these are our leaky dams #SmithillsEstate https://t.co/Kmbpsl93v6

Yesterday I visited our #Bentley pumping station in #Doncaster which is nearing completion.

I’ll save other pics and details for @GavinUsherEA to release on completion but it’s great to see #Sustainability here with 22kwh #EVchargers installed, lots more to come hopefully 🤞 https://t.co/92hzEZ7cqa
How do you say goodbye to an ecosystem? River Kent in Kendal has the highest level of protection possible but doesn't mean anything to @EnvAgency

tweets.text: Dirty water from our homes should go to a water treatment works not into our rivers or seas. Wrongly connected pipes cause pollution and harm wildlife. Make sure you @connectrightUK #NationalDrainageMisconnectionDay #BinIt4Beaches #RainDownTheDrain. https://t.co/PLaKsIqCVi

Hugely welcome news; Not only was Anna Bacon @Waterman_group a Co-Chair of the environmental practitioner apprenticeship, we had support from Emma Wilcox @SocEnv_HQ and Paul Cross @EnvAgency - great team put together @IFAteched; we also welcome our part in the Green Community! https://t.co/i9zhLtdxNE

tweets.text: It is time the UK had its own rewilding programme for eel in the UK depleted waters @EelGroup we are after support @RewildingB @BenGoldsmith @ScottishEPA @EnvAgency @WetlandsInt @Shoal_Org @WWTSlimbridge @WWFLeadWater @theriverstrust @WildlifeTrusts https://t.co/2t9R4HEbqH

Always working with the polluters 😬Advisory😬Enforcement & then Environmental undertakings where for a donation of a bundle of 💷 to a environmental charity you can escape prosecution 🤬illegal waste disposal pays Tougher deterrents needed @EnvAgency https://t.co/7A46a5pdkM
@EnvAgencyYNE @EnvAgency It's good that you are raising awareness of this, but do you or the government check individual properties/streets where pollution levels in the run-off sewer pipes are high?
@johncurtinEA @EnvAgency Congratulations with this impressive milestone. Protecting people against flooding is a large responsibility!

We did it! Today we pass the target of 300000 homes better protected from flooding. Massive congrats to all involved. Here’s a taster of just four of the 700 schemes that were part of that success - but can you name them? https://t.co/5xFUVds5wU https://t.co/xtz5gGxeY6

There's never been a better time to #makeadifference. #TeamEA are looking for our next #Deputydirector of #Flood and Coastal Risk Management and would love to hear how you can be part of our future. Find out more at  https://t.co/1eKolklxB2 https://t.co/9Z4DeE6Bh5

tweets.text: Good to see that the @EnvAgencySE has followed up on the oil spillage in the #Silkstream which we reported earlier and are working to recover the oil from the stream and have placed another boom in the river to stop the oil from flowing on&polluting the Welsh Harp! @thameswater https://t.co/rRGE1aQL9A https://t.co/OBSa9JHOJI

There should be no vaccination till ready to vaccinate the whole world within a short period i.e., in one go, to have Herd Immunity at a given point of time otherwise Epidemiological studies in past had proved that partial herd-immunity is more dangerous. https://t.co/1DGBsFeqEv

tweets.text: In 2015 the @EnvAgency set a target to better protect 300,000 homes from the risk of flooding by March 2021. We are thrilled to be a part of that milestone. The fully operational #BostonBarrier better protects 13,732 properties from tidal flooding in Boston! #FCERM #TeamEA https://t.co/hXgNEhSWZk

tweets.text: @_RobbieMoore @bradfordmdc @AireIncinerator @EnvAgency Your opening paragraph is a complete fabrication of the facts. The application for the incinerator was made by Endless Energy (a private company with no connection to the council). The Council are the local planning authority who have to follow guidelines set by your government.

300,000 homes are better protected from flooding, and the #flood defence in #Cannington #Somerset protects 200 of them. The flood bypass channel takes excess flood water away from the village and reduces flood risk to the A39. It was completed in 2017 at a cost of £4.5 million. https://t.co/WPX35U8DJo

@WasteCrimeWatch @scottdegg @EnvAgency High risk illegal waste sites ?
What about the high risk LEGAL ones ?   What about non-compliant waste operators like @RedIndustries2 and their systematic gassing of the local population?

New flood defences near Cardigan Fields on the Kirkstall Road are taking shape. 

Pre made concrete units are being installed to reduce flood risk to businesses in the area. The materials are sourced in the UK to reduce our carbon footprint.

#Leeds #flooding https://t.co/wF5rwi2pZJ

Once again it takes years and ‘numerous letters’ before action is taken against blatant criminals. @EnvAgency have been given powers to move faster so why do they still pursue policies of appeasement with those who disregard our environment? https://t.co/XpKB87Fjd9
A major achievement for the @EnvAgency today - 300,000 homes better protected from flooding and more resilient to Climate Change 🌊🎉 https://t.co/Vot0MCOebk

Media coverage isn’t part of the justice system...

... but a consequence of it...

... and here is @itvmeridian’s take on the conviction of two #Buckinghamshire men...

... we prosecuted for burning waste illegally 

Watch video of the fire 🎥🔥⬇️ https://t.co/Cp3WkOEtuZ

tweets.text: More than 300,000 homes are better protected from flooding since 2015 - 90 of these were in #Godalming after a 525-metre flood wall was built along the banks of the Hell’s Ditch. https://t.co/bzI0I4vq05

The #BostonBarrier is one of more than 700 @EnvAgency schemes which have contributed to better protecting 300,000 homes from flooding over the last 6 years. An incredible achievement & a credit to all of those who have worked to enhance the resilience of our communities. #TeamEA https://t.co/SKNVL6qqOe
@RochdaleCouncil @EnvAgency Why not just make the tip more accessible and don't train the staff to be Nazis??
Come on, people. This is an SSSI. At least adapt it for sandmartins! @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency Hereford! https://t.co/FgnAxOonwX

@StinkStopthe @Sotlive Unbelievable, you are aware locally of @RedIndustries2 mismanagement of Walleys Landfill? The stench that is out of control!No mention of their significant permit breaches? The stink? The health issues? The @EnvAgencyMids monitoring? The complaints from @UHNM_NHS ? #stopthestink

@yahoo_pete @EnvAgency Thank you Pete. It's been quite a journey hasn't it? 12 months ago to the day, I tweeted this from the @FloodDigitalEA account. I don't think I was too far off...😉 https://t.co/lHWH7NKmjn

Thank you to the members of the public who contacted our incident hotline to let us know a large tree had fallen in the River Idle, near #Retford.

This was a #floodrisk and it has now been cleared.

You can report an incident on 0800 80 70 60 (24 hr service). https://t.co/WsdktEmD0b

Motion approved. Council resolves to instruct the Chief Executive to write to the Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs requesting the @EnvAgency is given greater and more robust powers to deal with industrial fly tippers as effectively and as quickly as possible

Can natural defences help protect the region against flooding? In Bolton log dams have been built to slow water down before it gets to the river. More on @GranadaReports at 6pm. @WoodlandTrust @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/8CNutd7Ij8
